eventName: Ideal City: Carnival in the Endless Summer
storyInfo: Several days later, the Durins start relocating to the surface, and while Stitch is working to restore Zeruertza to perfect form before its impending destruction, he unexpectedly finds himself reading a letter his teacher left behind for him.

attributes.content: A few days later...
Stitch is working hard at the forum again today.
Just like the journey to the surface, the dressing of the city is a task that requires the supervision of all the citizens.
And as the face of the city, the dome's renovation is naturally the most important task.
Which is why it is also necessary for the design tasks to be done in the forum, where everyone can see.
And as Master Edge claims, it also saves time.
That darned old man. He's definitely having me do this because he thinks it's funny.
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Noticing Edge's smug look below, Stitch finds himself immediately incensed.
However, not even he himself expected to adapt so quickly to these work conditions.
When he has to take questions from passersby, when he has to hear opinions, and even when he stands up and defends his beliefs in an argumentâ€”
None of that actually carries as much pressure as he thought it would.
With Edge grinning away at him, Stitch is definitely irritated, but he also knows what people must be thinking about him.
Just like how they must know what he is thinking.
This little runt. He's had more arguments than I could count the past few days.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Just because someone dared to give him some feedback, he had to argue for the better part of the day.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Still, the work he's turning in is impeccable.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Finch, I don't know where in the world you've tromped off to, but you can rest easy now.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Oh, right, right.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Stitch!
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: What is it? I'm working here!
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Somebody found a letter at the top of the dome while it was being inspected.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: A letter?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Yep, and it's for you.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: No way...!
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.text: I am Finch Canvas, the Zeruertza's greatest architectural designer.
I placed this letter at the top of the dome.
I am sure the one who opens it will be the next person to renovate it.
I hope that he is my dearest student.
This letter is for him.
However, if you are not him, then please do not give him this letter.
As that would mean he has failed.

attributes.content: Sorry, Catch.
attributes.name: Deculture Silvermint

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: If only I were more like you...
attributes.name: Deculture Silvermint

attributes.content: Everyone's personality is different, and I can understand the way you think, too.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: All I can say is, if I'd found out a little sooner, maybe things could've turned out different.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: You're allowed to stay, you know.
attributes.name: Deculture Silvermint

attributes.content: It's fine.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: *Sigh*, it feels like I did something terrible to you.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Not at all, Elysium. I really appreciate your suggestion.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: It's true that I made this decision to give him that push at first, but I also really want to seek out Master Finch.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: I'm sure he'll be very happy to hear how Stitch is doing.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: Well, you've made it plenty hard for me to know what to say here.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Speaking of which, it sounds like this Master Finch really cares about his student. I have a hunch that he might have gone to the surface to seek a cure for Oripathy.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: After I leave, I will try my best to track him down, too.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Hah, perhaps he will one day find his way to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Oh, now there's a plan.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: You know what I'm trying to say, right?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Yeah, we'll meet again.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: I know I want to help out when we finally rebuild Zeruertza.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: And when the time comes, I am going to work together with Stitch to put out some amazing designs.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: Like a statue of me?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Well... Maybe not that.
attributes.name: Catch Lightrace

attributes.content: A shame!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.text: First, I must apologize to you for my departure.
But if I had not left, knowing you, you would never become truly independent.
Alright, truth be told, if I decided to stay, I wouldn't have known how to stop caring for you.
You have a gift.
Oripathy has greatly limited your lifespan, but at the same time, it has made you see life in a more profound way.
Thanks to this, your style has greatly transformed for the better.
I can tell.

attributes.content: Here we go, let's pull it together. Our job today is the blow all the caverns in this area!
attributes.name: Excited Archosauria

attributes.content: You hear that, Yogi?
attributes.name: Yota

attributes.content: Yes, Brother!
attributes.name: Yogi

attributes.content: *yawn*, Yota, did you have to start working this early?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: What are you talking about, Inam?
attributes.name: Yota

attributes.content: This is a mission Gavial gave us herself.
attributes.name: Yota

attributes.content: She saved my life. If I could, I would dig through the earth to meet her right now and check how she's been doing.
attributes.name: Yota

attributes.content: She'll still be alive and kicking, well after you're dead.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Haha, that's for sure.
attributes.name: Yota

attributes.content: Right, I'll be leaving tomorrow to meet the Pasha and discuss the lord ameer business.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: So, starting tomorrow, Zumama's in charge. Got it?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: How about I come with you, then?
attributes.name: Yogi

attributes.content: Didn't you say the Pasha is a pain to deal with?
attributes.name: Yogi

attributes.content: For you, yeah. The Pasha would grind you until there's nothing left.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Don't worry. I haven't been a Messenger all these years for nothing.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Alright, Zumama, I'll leave this to you.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Don't worry.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: We've installed the 'Mountain Breaker Mk. III' on the Raging Ironhide.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: That'll put its efficiency up three-fold.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: You could even leave me this whole place.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Sometimes... I feel like you're even scarier than Gavial.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.text: At the same time, this has made your style more and more extreme.
And the more you stood firm with your style, the more you despised working with others.
This worried me.

attributes.content: By the way, Avdotya. What are you going to do once you make it to the surface?
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: What else can I do?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: You can't believe I will settle down for a life on land just because of the speech I gave?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Once Zeruertza is rebuilt, I will be back.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Is there a problem?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Right... Actually, this only just came back to me, but I made a promise to Inam.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: We agreed that if I ever went to the surface, I would do business with her, and she would also introduce me to a place called Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: But I don't know that much about the surface, so I told her you would be our middleman, and I could learn from you.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: So that means...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: You sold me to her?!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I'm sorry! But I really want to try doing business on the surface. Please, help me out!
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface
Avdotya
attributes.content: Croooooque! Diamondfaaaaaaaace!

attributes.name: Avdotya
attributes.content: Didn't I tell you not to drink?!
I'm really, really sorry!
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.text: When aloofness yields no result, it only devolves into misconception.
It tells you that it isn't your fault that others don't understand you. It tells you that others are in the wrong for not understanding your work.
But sometimes, that couldn't be further from the truth.
You can of course hold on to the way you think.
However, if your line of thought is really so fine and exquisite, shouldn't you try your best to share it all the more?

attributes.content: Phew, this pillar will look just fine here.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I didn't expect them to want to renovate the forum, too. The Durins are a thorough bunch, aren't they?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Gavial.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Do you realize that you are making history?
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Is that right?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: The Durins have lived underground for ages without making any large-scale effort at communicating with the world on the surface.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Yet your choices have persuaded an entire city to relocate to the surface all at once.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Who would have thought that Acahualla would be the first place to know such an intimate level of exchange with a Durin city and its people?
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: And when future generations look back, it will probably never occur to them that this all happened because of an offhand idea you came up with.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Now that you mention it, I guess you're right.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: But there's nothing wrong with that, is there?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Haha, there's of course nothing wrong with that.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: What I'm saying isâ€”History is always like that, Gavial.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: It might have been an accident that the Durins were able to put down roots underground, too.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: This goes to show that perhaps history is nothing to be revered or feared, just like the Acahuallan traditions that you so easily destroyed.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Now I'm not so sure about that. I think people who know their history pretty great.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Like Dr. Kal'tsit. She knows history like the back of her hand.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Kal'tsit? Hm... I could count the number of times we've dealt with each other on one hand, but she might be the one person in the whole world who takes history the lightest.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Is that right?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Of course. And I suspect the way she goes about it might even be a kind of helplessness, the kind that comes from knowing nothing can be done.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Now then, let's change the subject.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Zumama told me that you wavered in your decision, but you persisted with it nonetheless, and that you plan to continue doing as much?
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Yeah, I mean, they all told me that they'll help me.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Speaking of, you're gonna stick with us till the end, right, old man?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Oh, look at you, won't even give an old man a break.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: It's probably obvious that I'm very happy to be researching technology with Zumama.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: But did you know that the longer you live, the harder it is to find direction?
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: I'm not sure I get it.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Well, that's good. That's what I like about you.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Keep going down the path you're on. I'm curious just how far you'll make it.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: So, how come you're here to talk to me instead of following Zumama around?
attributes.name: Gavial
High Priest
attributes.content: Well, naturally, that's becauseâ€”

attributes.name: High Priest
attributes.content: She kicked me out!
I told her the Durin machines are nowhere near as cute as the Big, Ugly Thing, and she got mad at me.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Hmph, how could she be this protective of her new friends? Now I'm mad too!
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Oh.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.text: There are certain things that you will never understand until you experience them yourself.
And so I am leaving you with a problem.
Until you become the next design representative,
and until you manage to persuade all of Zeruertza that your work has a profound meaning within...
I will leave your side, and you are not allowed to come look for me.
We are architects, and our job is to provide designs that satisfy the masses.
You will come to understand that this is the greatest challenge you will ever face. Not a design flaw, not a construction problem, but rather something as simple as being persuasive.

attributes.content: Whoa, Tomimi, you feel that?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Yeah, it's shaking.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I'm surprised we can still feel it even though we've taken the lift all the way up here.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Those are some huge tremors.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: But all the Zeruertzans have made it to the surface. Every last one of them!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Yeah, everyone's done a great job.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Hrrrhhh...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: You okay? I told you to drop the tough act, but you had to be the last one to leave the city.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: What inspiration can you get from watching it crumble anyway?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You wouldn't understand, even if I told you.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: That was the final moment of an entire city. It simply... overwhelmed me with emotion.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Master... This might be impossibly difficult, but I will give it my best shot.
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: And you, little whelp. What are you mumbling to yourself?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: He... He looks exhausted.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Well, can you blame him? He's been working really hard.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Not only did he actually manage to design the thing, he went to the construction site every day, and even insisted on being the last one out.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: A while back, I wouldn't have expected him to be such a responsible guy.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Yeah, I'm starting to see him in a different light, too!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Alright, let's go.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: We're the last ones. Everyone's waiting for us.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Mm-hm!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: How come Gavial isn't back yet? She didn't get into trouble, did she?
attributes.name: Yogi

attributes.content: Don't jinx it!
attributes.name: Yota

attributes.content: She's here.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Now where is Avdotya? I'm eager to see the waterfall.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: You could go on ahead.
attributes.name: Deculture Silvermint

attributes.content: Now that won't do. This is a... how do you say this? Right, a historic moment!
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: A large crowd of Durins and Tiacauh have gathered in front of the mine.
They are all waiting for the last group to ride the elevator to the surface.
Wearing her usual smile, Gavial steps out with Stitch in tow.
She raises her right hand and greets the crowd, all of whom are beaming.
Today's a good day, everybody. Let's head to the lake for some fun!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Before she can finish her sentence, the crowd has already erupted in cheers.
Today, Acahualla is a tad bit more lively than before.
And in the future, it might get even livelier.
